image.altText: Weona Park Stud

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian horse breeder has been told to reduce the number of horses on her property and rehome them, after concerns were raised by members of the racing community.

title.children: Horse breeder feels 'harassed' after social media storm leads to inspection

image.altText: A map showing a red circle over a national park in Tasmania's west.

props.synopsis: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

title.children: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania like a 'thunderclap'

image.altText: A young man with shoulder-length red hair and a young woman with braided blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Jack and Anna swapped the humidity of Queensland for chilly days in Tasmania, but is Tasmania really the climate refuge many think it is?

title.children: 'This is not normal': Australians moving to Tasmania to escape climate heat

image.altText: An elderly woman with a trolley seen from behind looking at the meat section of a supermarket.

props.synopsis: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

title.children: Rise in grocery thefts 'crazy' but prices unlikely to come down

image.altText: A building facade in a pedestrian mall.

props.synopsis: Launceston City Council bought the historic Birchalls building for $8.8 million five years ago. A ratepayer association says it has learnt of a proposal to give it away "for nothing".

title.children: 'Why did they buy it?': Concerns $7.1m council building could be given away

image.altText: A man gestures as he looks at camera.

props.synopsis: The trial of two brothers and another man accused of the stabbing murder of a man in Tasmania's north in 2022 hears there is "no serious dispute" that Luke Shaw "was the person who killed" David Jenkins.

title.children: Final arguments heard from trio accused of 2022 stabbing murder

image.altText: A swimming pool surrounded by grass with a pale green building in the background.

props.synopsis: The Derwent Valley Council will vote on Thursday night whether the pool will reopen, or whether the area will be turned into a park or something else.

title.children: Community urges council keep Bushy Park pool ahead of tonight's vote

image.altText: A man wearing a bright red jacket, traditional necklaces and a white scarf with blue stripes.

props.synopsis: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt question his motives.

title.children: Devotees say he's 'chosen by God'. Is this new PM the Trump of the Pacific?

image.altText: china's president xi jinping speaks into two microphones while sat behind a desk

props.synopsis: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

title.children: China plans to reduce its carbon emissions by 7 to 10 per cent by 2035

image.altText: A headshot of Peter Tonagh.

props.synopsis: He replaces Catherine West, who spent 18 months in the position.

title.children: Former ABC deputy chair Peter Tonagh to step up as Nine chair

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is majority-owned by Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

title.children: Singapore's PM is Optus's majority shareholder. Here's why that could be a problem

image.altText: Woman with smallish, white, fluffy dog sitting on her lap as she reclines on the couch

props.synopsis: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

title.children: An ‘Apple vs Samsung charger dilemma’ is holding us back from gaming our power

image.altText: An anonymous woman's hands folded, with a piece of paper in her lap that reads 'Representing Yourself in The Family Court'.

props.synopsis: Jacinta says she is part of a "big wave" of litigants self-representing in Family Court of Australia proceedings after facing extraordinary fees from family law firms.

title.children: 'Crushing': DV survivor left to represent themselves in Family Court

image.altText: A UTS building in the background with torn pieces of paper scattered over the top with words from reports written on them

props.synopsis: The National Student Ombudsman is investigating allegations UTS failed to improve its response to sexual harm and gender-based violence despite four reviews since 2022.

title.children: UTS students say they regret reporting sexual harassment as ombudsman investigates

image.altText: Ted Cruz wearing a blue suit speaking at a press conference in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title.children: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says

image.altText: GettyImages-2175170997

props.synopsis: The AFL announces that only seven AFL players will run in the traditional grand final sprint, with Olympic boxer Harry Garside also joining in.

title.children: AFL confirms major change to grand final sprint, as Olympian set to run

image.altText: Year 11 high school student with long, straight brown hair, and braces.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

title.children: 'Spectacle of disrespect' at Welcome to Country inspires teen essay

image.altText: Silver pointy ARIA Award trophy emblazoned with ARIA logo, sitting on concrete against blue brick background.

props.synopsis: All the contenders are hopefuls vying for ARIA Awards glory at the music industry's glitzy ceremony, taking place next month.

title.children: The 2025 ARIA Award nominees - the full list

image.altText: A Macquarie sign.

props.synopsis: Macquarie Investment Management has committed to repaying thousands of Australians who invested hundreds of millions of their retirement savings in the collapsed Shield Master Fund amid admissions it contravened the Corporations Act.

title.children: Macquarie to repay Shield investors after super platform failures

image.altText: An elderly woman with a trolley seen from behind looking at the meat section of a supermarket.

props.synopsis: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

title.children: Rise in grocery thefts 'crazy' but prices unlikely to come down

image.altText: A man in a blue tracksuit and hat bowls on a green with flags of different countries flying in the background.

props.synopsis: It may not seem like the place to host a prestigious World Bowls competition, but a small Murray River town is doing just that.

title.children: World's best bowlers fight for prestigious title in small border town

image.altText: a punter at the rodeo holding a beer with a stubbie that says 'spurs on condom on'

props.synopsis: Health providers in outback Queensland are taking a light-hearted approach to promoting safe sex, as new data shows sexually transmitted infections are on the rise.

title.children: Rodeo attendees told to 'wrap it like a haybale' as STI rates climb

image.altText: Eggs in an egg carton.

props.synopsis: Eggs are back on supermarket shelves in abundance after shortages caused by bird flu. But do you know what labels like caged and barn-laid mean?

title.children: Do you know what you're buying when choosing between egg labels?

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

title.children: China's lead over the US in South-East Asia is likely to grow

image.altText: An illustration shows several people's face and AI is taking jobs

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is coming for our jobs — but will it take them away, or just give us a powerful new assistant?

title.children: 'Waiting for the axe to fall': Fears for jobs in AI boom

image.altText: A woman holding a flower in bushland

props.synopsis: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

title.children: Tired of police ‘excuses’: Family of missing people demand change

image.altText: Jennie and Ray give smile deeply at each other in an open-top car. They are in wedding dress and suit.

props.synopsis: Detectives are this week revisiting the site in WA's outback where the body of prospector Ray Kehlet was found. His wife Jennie is still missing.

title.children: Police on the hunt for missing boots, gloves in fresh cold case search

image.altText: A motorcycle on its side with a crashed car.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 14 people in Taiwan as it struck the southern Chinese coast.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa slams south China, after lashing Taiwan, Hong Kong

image.altText: Coal rocks in the foreground with people in the background standing in high vis

props.synopsis: Nearly 300 workers from mines and work sites have had cases of lung cancer, black lung and other illnesses recorded by the state's dust disease register in the space of 12 months.

title.children: Queensland records hundreds of new cases of deadly dust-related illness

image.altText: A white cow wandering on a gravel road.

props.synopsis: A Katanning school bus driver and local farmers are calling for urgent action to address a growing danger posed by wandering livestock on rural roads.

title.children: Penalties labelled 'woefully inadequate' as cattle roam roads for decades

image.altText: A pregnant woman touching her tummy.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's latest health advice goes against the evidence, stigmatises autism and unfairly blames women.

title.children: Trump's 'tough it out' advice to pregnant women is dangerous

image.altText: Neurons

props.synopsis: Clinical trials of a groundbreaking new gene therapy for Huntington's disease have shown that it slows progression of the condition by 75 per cent after three years, researchers say.

title.children: Groundbreaking gene therapy for Huntington's slows progression of disease

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel standing on a red carpet looking at the camera and smiling.

props.synopsis: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

title.children: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views, Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'

image.altText: Swimmer with one arm on the edge of the pool, screaming and pumping her fist with joy after winning

props.synopsis: Alexa Leary's win in the final individual event of Wednesday night's action in Singapore bookended a golden night for Australia after Callum Simpson won gold in the first event of the evening.

title.children: Leary, Simpson storm to World Para Swimming Championships golds

image.altText: A man in glasses looks to the right of the camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou says the public would embrace a gay men's player and rejects that the AFL is an unsafe environment.

title.children: Former AFL boss denies league is unsafe for gay men's players
